results.title: The Ouyen Taxi Driver
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: The town of Ouyen has only one taxi driver. Meet Ross Missen and see the town of Ouyen through his eyes, meet some of his regular customers and learn why locals love him.

results.title: The Outsiders = Bande a part
results.creator_credit: Anouchka Films, Dorsay Films, Philippe Dussart and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: There is a girl and two men with a gun. The girl is going out with one man but falls in love with another. They plan a robbery. The robbery goes wrong. One of the men dies. The plot is schematic, based on Dolores Hitchen’s pulp crime novel “Fool’s Gold”, but in this enormously influential modernist film, Godard is less interested in the genre tropes of the thriller narrative than he is in using the grammar of cinema to explore the existential and romantic concerns of his time and place. So, amongst the cheap gun play and B-movie eroticism, there are quotes from Shakespeare and from Le Figaro’s analysis of the massacres in Rwanda; a character’s father is Arthur Rimbaud and Anna Karina’s face becomes the catalyst for some of cinema’s most romantic enthusings on beauty and on love. “Bande A Part” saw a young Godard begin to explore both the philosophical and plastic possibilities of cinema, and to begin his playful experimentation with sound and vision which was to make him the world’s most influential film director. His influence can still be seen in the recurrent use of moments and scenes from “Band A Part” in contemporary film-making: Hal Hartley punkishly re-invented the dance sequence from this movie in his “Simple Men”; Quentin Tarantino named his production company A Band Apart. The crisp black and white cinematography is by Raoul Coutard, the elegant music by Michel Legrand. Alongside Karina, the film stars Sami Frey and Claude Brasseur. Decades may have passed since it was first made, but seeing this movie still feels like drinking from the elixir of youth. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Outsiders
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Warner Bros Pictures, Pony Boy, Fred Roos, Gray Frederickson and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: The first of two films made by Coppola in 1983 and based on novels by youth fiction writer S.E. Hinton (‘The Outsiders’ was her first novel, published when she was just seventeen). Like ‘Rumble Fish’, ‘The Outsiders’ was a rites-of-passage novel that focused on the lives of disenfranchised urban male youth. Set in 1966 in Tulsa, Oklahoma, it follows the lives of the members of two rival teenage street gangs; the middle-class Greasers and the working-class Socs. When Ponyboy, the youngest of three orphaned boys who hang out with the Greasers, and his friend Johnny, are involved in a deadly confrontation with the Socs one night, the two are forced to hide out and reconsider the direction their lives are taking. Cast includes Matt Dillon, Ralph Macchio, Patrick Swayze, Rob Lowe, Emilio Estevez, Tom Cruise and Tom Waits. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: The Outsider
results.brief_description: Poses the problem of a girl who, through psychological inhibition, feels cut off from normal, friendly social relations with her school-fellows. Briefly shows how she tends to behave as an isolated individual; how other children distrust and resent her. Another girl tries to understand her difficulties, gives her the opportunity of mixing with the group. The film is stated in simple terms, addressed to secondary school level.

results.title: The Outsider
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project and Barry Washington
results.brief_description: Richard McRoberts and Gary Kinnance begin the discussion with a brief survey of Albert Camus’ life and philosophy to set a background for a fuller treatment of the book. Specific passages are used as springboards for the analysis and explication of Camus’ themes. The meaning and place of “The Outsiders” as a piece of existential literature is discussed.

results.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Company, Robert Daley and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Josey Wales (Clint Eastwood) becomes physically and emotionally scarred when Union gorillas murder his family and destroy his Missouri farm. Turning vigilante and ending up with a price on his head, he journeys to Texas and becomes a much-feared Confederate raider. Wales becomes the unwilling centre of a loose community when he picks up survivors of a wagon train ambushed by Comancheros (engagingly played by an excellent supporting cast which includes Sondra Locke). Ultimately, Wales can’t bring himself to leave his motley surrogate family unprotected. Eastwood had not intended to direct as well as star in his twenty-sixth feature film. The directorial assignment had been given to co-writer Phil Kaufman who exited from the picture early on during location shooting and Eastwood, taking over, performed a first-rate job. The film also received an Academy Award nomination for music.

results.title: The Outlaw
results.brief_description: A highly fictionalized account of the rivalry and tenuous friendship between Billy the Kidd (Jack Beutel), Doc Holliday (Walter Huston), Pat Garrett (Mitchell Thomas) and a half breed girl (Jane Russel in her screen debut). Much controversy surrounded the films release regarding supposedly steamy scenes between Jack Beutel and Jane Russel, and Hughes’ obvious fixation with Russel’s chest.

results.title: The Otto cycle: gasoline engine
results.creator_credit: Visual Aids Committee, American Association of Physic Teachers and Audio Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Graphically presents the six processes in the gasoline engine cycle. The ideal situation with the elimination of disturbing factors is demonstrated and the Otto cycle is traced on a pressure-volume diagram. The concept of thermal efficiency is discussed in this film.

results.title: The Other World
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Bittman and Claudia Overing
results.brief_description: An exploration of the world of plant and animal life in a Canadian stream. Using underwater and microphotography film techniques, the camera follows some of these underwater life cycles and shows the interdependence of insect, fish and mammal life, which in turn are dependent upon the purity of the water.
